metadata.author: pokemon
metadata.description: Pokemon Trading Card Game Fossil Set - Complete 62 Card Set

cards.name: Aerodactyl

attacks.name: Wing Attack
attacks.text: Wing Attack does 30 damage to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.description: A ferocious, prehistoric Pokémon that goes for the enemy's throat with its serrated saw-like fangs.

cards.name: Articuno

attacks.name: Freeze Dry
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Blizzard
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. If tails, this attack does 10 damage to each of your own Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.description: A legendary bird Pokémon that is said to appear to doomed people who are lost in icy mountains.

cards.name: Ditto
cards.description: Capable of copying an enemy's genetic code to instantly transform itself into a duplicate of the enemy.

cards.name: Dragonite

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Hyper Beam
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any Energy cards attached to it, choose 1 of them and discard it.

cards.description: An extremely rarely seen marine Pokémon. Its intelligence is said to match that of humans.

cards.name: Gengar

attacks.name: Curse
attacks.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may move 1 damage counter from 1 of your opponent's Pokémon to another (even if it would Knock Out the other Pokémon). This power can't be used if Gengar is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Dark Mind
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and this attack does 10 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.description: Under a full moon, this Pokémon likes to mimic the shadows of people and laugh at their fright.

cards.name: Haunter

attacks.name: Transparency
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Haunter.

attacks.name: Nightmare
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.description: Because of its ability to slip through block walls, it is said to be from another dimension.

cards.name: Hitmonlee

attacks.name: Stretch Kick
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and this attack does 20 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: High Jump Kick
attacks.text: High Jump Kick does 50 damage to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.description: When in a hurry, its legs lengthen progressively. It runs smoothly with extra long, loping strides.

cards.name: Hypno

attacks.name: Prophecy
attacks.text: Look at up to 3 cards from the top of either player's deck and rearrange them as you like.

attacks.name: Dark Mind
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and this attack does 10 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.description: When it locks eyes with an enemy, it will use a mix of PSI moves such as Hypnosis and Confusion.

cards.name: Kabutops

attacks.name: Sharp Sickle
attacks.text: Sharp Sickle does 30 damage to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Absorb
attacks.text: Remove a number of damage counters from Kabutops equal to half the damage done to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance) (rounded up to the nearest 10). If Kabutops has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.

cards.description: Its sleek shape is perfect for swimming. It slashes prey with its claws and drains the body fluids.

cards.name: Lapras

attacks.name: Water Gun
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Lapras but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.description: A Pokémon that has been overhunted almost to extinction. It can ferry people across the water.

cards.name: Magneton

attacks.name: Thunder Wave
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Selfdestruct
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to each Pokémon on each player's Bench. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Magneton does 80 damage to itself.

cards.description: Formed by several Magnemites linked together. They frequently appear when sunspots flare up.

cards.name: Moltres

attacks.name: Wildfire
attacks.text: You may discard any number of Fire Energy cards attached to Moltres when you use this attack. If you do, discard that many cards from the top of your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Dive Bomb
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.description: Known as the legendary bird of fire. Every flap of its wings creates a dazzling flash of flames.

cards.name: Muk

attacks.name: Sludge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned; if tails, it is now Confused.

cards.description: Thickly covered with a filthy, vile sludge. It is so toxic, even its footprints contain poison.

cards.name: Raichu

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Raichu.

attacks.name: Thunder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Raichu does 30 damage to itself.

cards.description: Its long tail serves as a ground to protect itself from its own high voltage power.

cards.name: Zapdos

attacks.name: Thunderstorm
attacks.text: For each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon, flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.description: A legendary bird Pokémon that is said to appear from clouds while dropping enormous lightning bolts.

cards.name: Aerodactyl

attacks.name: Wing Attack
attacks.text: Wing Attack does 30 damage to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.description: A ferocious, prehistoric Pokémon that goes for the enemy's throat with its serrated saw-like fangs.

attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Lapras but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost.

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Thunder Wave
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Selfdestruct
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to each Pokémon on each player's Bench. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Magneton does 80 damage to itself.

cards.name: Moltres

attacks.name: Wildfire
attacks.text: You may discard any number of Fire Energy cards attached to Moltres when you use this attack. If you do, discard that many cards from the top of your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Dive Bomb
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.description: Known as the legendary bird of fire. Every flap of its wings creates a dazzling flash of flames.

attacks.name: Sludge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned; if tails, it is now Confused.

cards.description: Thickly covered with a filthy, vile sludge. It is so toxic, even its footprints contain poison.

cards.name: Raichu

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Raichu.

attacks.name: Thunder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Raichu does 30 damage to itself.

cards.description: Its long tail serves as a ground to protect itself from its own high voltage power.

cards.name: Zapdos

attacks.name: Thunderstorm
attacks.text: For each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon, flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.description: A legendary bird Pokémon that is said to appear from clouds while dropping enormous lightning bolts.

cards.name: Arbok

attacks.name: Terror Strike
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Poison Fang
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.description: It is rumored that the ferocious warning markings on its belly differ from area to area.

cards.name: Cloyster

attacks.name: Clamp
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Spike Cannon
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

cards.description: When attacked, it launches its horns in quick volleys. Its innards have never been seen.

cards.name: Gastly

attacks.name: Sleeping Gas
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Destiny Bond
attacks.text: Discard 1 Psychic Energy card attached to Gastly in order to use this attack. If, during your opponent's next turn, an attack Knocks Out Gastly, Knock Out the attacking Pokémon.

cards.description: Almost invisible, this gaseous Pokémon cloaks the target and puts it to sleep without notice.

cards.name: Golbat

attacks.name: Screech
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Leech Life
attacks.text: Remove a number of damage counters from Golbat equal to half the damage done to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance) (rounded up to the nearest 10). If Golbat has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.

cards.description: Once it strikes, it will not stop draining energy from the victim even if it gets too heavy to fly.

cards.name: Golem

attacks.name: Avalanche
attacks.text: Golem does 10 damage to itself.

cards.description: Its boulder-like body is extremely hard. It can easily withstand dynamite blasts without taking damage.

cards.name: Graveler

attacks.name: Harden
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, whenever 30 or less damage is done to Graveler (after applying Weakness and Resistance), prevent that damage. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

attacks.name: Rock Throw
attacks.text: Rock Throw does 40 damage to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.description: Rolls down slopes to move. It rolls over any obstacle without slowing or changing its direction.

cards.name: Kingler

attacks.name: Flail
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on Kingler.

attacks.name: Crabhammer
attacks.text: Crabhammer does 40 damage to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.description: The large pincer has 10,000 hp of crushing power. Exerts its enormous power to tackle carrying out its biggest attacks.

cards.name: Magmar

attacks.name: Fire Punch
attacks.text: Fire Punch does 30 damage to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard 1 Fire Energy card attached to Magmar in order to use this attack.

cards.description: Its body always burns with an orange glow that enables it to hide perfectly among flames.

cards.name: Omastar

attacks.name: Water Gun
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Omastar but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost.

attacks.name: Spike Cannon
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

cards.description: A prehistoric Pokémon that died out when its heavy shell made it impossible to catch prey.

cards.name: Sandslash

attacks.name: Slash
attacks.text: Slash does 30 damage to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

cards.description: Curls up into a spiny ball when threatened. It can roll while curled up to attack or escape.

cards.name: Seadra

attacks.name: Water Gun
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Seadra but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost.

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Seadra.

cards.description: Capable of swimming backwards by rapidly flapping its wing-like pectoral fins and stout tail.

cards.name: Slowbro

attacks.name: Strange Behavior
attacks.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may move 1 damage counter from Slowbro to 1 of your other Pokémon. This power can't be used if Slowbro is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Psyshock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.description: The Shellder that is latched onto Slowpoke's tail is said to feed on the host's left-over scraps.

cards.name: Tentacruel

attacks.name: Supersonic
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Jellyfish Sting
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.description: The tentacles are normally kept short. On hunts, they are extended to ensnare and immobilize prey.

cards.name: Weezing

attacks.name: Smog
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Selfdestruct
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each Pokémon on each player's Bench. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Weezing does 60 damage to itself.

cards.description: Where two kinds of poison gases meet, 2 Koffings can fuse into a Weezing over many years.

cards.name: Ekans

attacks.name: Spit Poison
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Wrap
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.description: Moves silently and stealthily. Eats the eggs of birds, such as Pidgey and Spearow, whole.

cards.name: Geodude

attacks.name: Stone Barrage
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

cards.description: Found in fields and mountains. Mistaking them for boulders, people often step or trip on them.

cards.name: Grimer

attacks.name: Nasty Goo
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed and Poisoned.

attacks.name: Minimize
attacks.text: All damage done to Grimer during your opponent's next turn is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.description: Appears in filthy areas. Thrives by sucking up polluted sludge that is pumped out of factories.

cards.name: Horsea

attacks.name: Smokescreen
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

cards.description: Known to shoot down flying bugs with precision blasts of ink from the surface of the water.

cards.name: Kabuto

attacks.name: Hide in Shell
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Kabuto.

attacks.name: Scratch
attacks.text: Scratch does 10 damage to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.description: A Pokémon that was resurrected from a fossil found in what was once the ocean floor eons ago.

cards.name: Krabby

attacks.name: Iron Grip
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

cards.description: Its pincers are not only powerful weapons, they are used for balance when walking sideways.

cards.name: Omanyte

attacks.name: Water Gun
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Omanyte but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost.

attacks.name: Withdraw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Omanyte during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

cards.description: Although long extinct, in rare cases, it can be genetically resurrected from fossils.

cards.name: Psyduck

attacks.name: Headache
attacks.text: Your opponent can't play Trainer cards during his or her next turn.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

cards.description: While lulling its enemies with its vacant look, this wily Pokémon will use psychokinetic powers.

cards.name: Shellder

attacks.name: Supersonic
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Hide in Shell
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Shellder.

cards.description: Its hard shell repels any kind of attack. It is vulnerable only when its shell is open.

cards.name: Slowpoke

attacks.name: Spacing Out
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, remove 1 damage counter from Slowpoke. This attack can't be used if Slowpoke has no damage counters on it.

attacks.name: Scavenge
attacks.text: Discard 1 Energy card attached to Slowpoke in order to use this attack. Put a Trainer card from your discard pile into your hand.

cards.description: Incredibly slow and dopey. It takes 5 seconds for it to feel pain when under attack.

cards.name: Tentacool

attacks.name: Acid
attacks.text: Acid does 10 damage to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.description: Drifts in shallow seas. Anglers who hook them by accident are often punished by their stingers.

cards.name: Zubat

attacks.name: Leech Life
attacks.text: Remove a number of damage counters from Zubat equal to half the damage done to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance) (rounded up to the nearest 10). If Zubat has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.

cards.description: Forms colonies in perpetually dark places. Uses ultrasonic waves to identify and approach targets.

cards.name: Mr. Fuji
cards.description: Choose a Pokémon on your Bench. Shuffle it and any cards attached to it into your deck.

trainerEffects.description: Choose a Pokémon on your Bench. Shuffle it and any cards attached to it into your deck

cards.name: Energy Search
cards.description: Search your deck for a basic Energy card and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

trainerEffects.description: Search deck for a basic Energy card

cards.name: Gambler
cards.description: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Flip a coin. If heads, draw 8 cards. If tails, draw 1 card.

trainerEffects.description: Shuffle hand into deck, then flip a coin
Draw 8 cards if heads, 1 if tails

cards.name: Recycle
cards.description: Flip a coin. If heads, put a basic Energy card from your discard pile into your hand.

trainerEffects.description: Flip a coin. If heads, put a basic Energy card from your discard pile into your hand

cards.name: Mysterious Fossil
cards.description: Play Mysterious Fossil as if it were a Basic Pokémon. While in play, Mysterious Fossil counts as a Pokémon (instead of a Trainer card). Mysterious Fossil has no attacks, can't retreat, and can't be Asleep, Confused, Paralyzed, or Poisoned. If Mysterious Fossil is Knocked Out, it doesn't count as a Knocked Out Pokémon. (Discard it anyway.) At any time during your turn before your attack, you may discard Mysterious Fossil.

trainerEffects.description: Play as a Basic Pokémon with special rules (evolves into fossil Pokémon)

cards.name: Mysterious Fossil
cards.description: Play Mysterious Fossil as if it were a Basic Pokémon. While in play, Mysterious Fossil counts as a Pokémon (instead of a Trainer card). Mysterious Fossil has no attacks, can't retreat, and can't be Asleep, Confused, Paralyzed, or Poisoned. If Mysterious Fossil is Knocked Out, it doesn't count as a Knocked Out Pokémon. (Discard it anyway.) At any time during your turn before your attack, you may discard Mysterious Fossil.

trainerEffects.description: Play as a Basic Pokémon with special rules (evolves into fossil Pokémon)
